title: Commander Keen Movie in Pre-Production
content:
Hello all, I have a project you may find interesting.

I am a student currently studying at The University of Manchester in the UK, and am making a movie. Not just any movie - a Commander Keen Movie. This will be live-action using the game plot and lots of original ideas in there (ie backstory to keen, more 'realistic' etc) and pretty spectacular effects. The movie is slated to be finished by Autumn 2007.

In case you are worried it will be naff I will shortlist my film-making experience: 2 films in my local cinema, Regional and National film award, several commissions and an honorary award. I am also a MAJOR keen fan so will deffo make it good.

The current status is that I have almost finalised a script and will shortly begin casting. I fully intend on letting the community in on it, hence I am telling you all about it.

As proof-of-word I present you with a very-very-very- early teaser poster that my FX guy came up with. Website and plenty of info will be online over summer, will keep you guys posted

[img noborder][url=http://www.flickr.com/photo_zoom.gne?id=137189694&size=l[/img]www.flickr.com/photo_zoom...ize=l[/img[/url]]

High-Res version available upon request

Regards,

title: ZOMG 133seven
content:
[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-surprise.gif[/img] Dude.

This is good news. A movie like this in the hands of an independent filmmaker sounds extremely promising [we can rest assured it won't turn out like DOOM].

Which episodes will you be covering? And how closely will the movie follow the actual gameplay? You should be able to cover all the core levels, since an episode can be speedrun in about 15 minutes, but I'm curious as to how you'll abstract them into the context of a movie.

Good luck. Do keep us informed.

title: Re: Commander Keen Movie in Pre-Production
content:
Hello all

Thank you for all your interest! To answer a few of your questions:

I am studying Computer Science. I intend to go to the London Film School after my studies (a contact is sponsoring me from the industry)

I have plenty of aliens and funny looking planets in my script, I am now going through the process of seeing what is feasible and what isnt. Depending on funding decides whether we have aliens in (costumes etc). I know good locations to film in for alien worlds (mountains, gravelpits, sandunes, rocky mountains) so the environments will look realistic.

I intend to stick very closely to the plot of 'Goodbye Galaxy'. The film will be 'self contained' as to speak, by which I mean I will include his backstory, expand on his adventures in space (eg going to burger joints on other planets) etc so people who do not know of Commander Keen can still enjoy it.

There will also be more action/adventure elements in it, one example is of a space-battle, big explosions etc.

Any further questions please ask [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

title: Re: Wait...
content:
Hey, quick update

our 3D guy says he can do environments in 3D (he can motion track scenes to match camera movements) and has given me a few test renders to prove it, these will be dumped on flikr shortly after this post

Unfortunatly I am the poor soul who is charged making the website, and I am utterly crap at it. If anyone would like this honor please get a hold of me otherwise I will attempt it.

Copyrights ... im trying to keep this below the radar for the moment. The general trend with these kind of things is that as long as you dont make money, your OK. I will of course try and get permission, but later on in the process so they wont dismiss me straight away. The last resort is the remove all references to anything copyrighted - but the whole point of this is to have them in :P

Some info about the technical aspects:

1) We are shooting in Hi-def (if possible)
2) We will be using steady-cams, cranes, etc
3) The people in it can actually act
4) We will remain faithful to the costume
5) Will be mixed in Dolby 5.1
6) Will have a heck-of-a-lot of 3D Graphics in
7) Explosions will be done using hi-res stock footage
[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dexter.gif[/img] You might recognise the music (will be uploading the main theme soon)

Script is almost finished, if anyone has any good ideas for inclusion now is the time!

Regards,

title: Re: bah.
content:
Well, thats different, in DW, the falible costumes are part of what makes it DW, I mean, nowdays they *could* do fancy realistic aliens, but then it wouldn't be the same, I know everyone in *my* family would complain.

Whereas Keen, well, Keen had never been 'realistic' before, if a movie is done right, 'poor' costume design can be an asset, adding to the mood, sometimes people don't want fancy glowing lights and transformations.

content:
small update you may enjoy, the music guy has started work on upgrading the CK themes and composing new original music! I asked him to play what he had so far, and I was not ready for a 30 minute masterpiece with all his ideas for the movie. It was so great in fact that I have asked him for a copy on CD so I can share it with you lot and get your feedback.

It is just a rough piano solo to demo ideas, will upload (somewhere) when I get it (tommorrow he promises if not today). Expect mistakes and loads of cinematic versions of CK tunes [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img]

If anyone would like to offer hosting space it would be appreciated [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

Regards,

EDIT:

PS: I would like to get the soundtrack done by full orchestra, if not it will be done with synths (no midi sounds thank you)

title: Re: Commander Keen Movie in Pre-Production
content:
Hey all, new update

Grafix has generously offered to create the CK website and provided me with FTP credentials. Thus I have uploaded the CK overture [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

Head on over to [url=http://commanderkeen.org/~mat/downloads/]commanderkeen.org/~mat/downloads/[/url] and download the MP3. It is about 11 mins long and weighs about 11 megs.

It is literally raw from a digital piano and thus includes a lot of mistakes. Its also a very early on work just testing themes but it provides a good overview of what the music in the film will be like.

Trailer shot still being worked on, still taking a bugger of a long time to render and apparently its crashing a lot. Will upload a few screenies of the bean n bacon rocket in the trailer later on tho. It will of course be in HD [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img]

Regards,

title: Re: Ooh!
content:
Wow... ok I must admit. I had thought that the production level of this movie would be... minimal. (Not that there was anything bad with that.) But from this song I can already tell that the quality of this production is well above what I had thought it was going to be.

I liked the song too. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img] (No really?!) The beginning few minutes of the piece seemed like it could be the "Build" music to The Sims. You know... where you go into the construction mode and start putting down trees, walls and put tile floor on your front lawn.

Now when it got to the "Aliens Ate my Babysitter" part I had to be reminded of "Linus and Lucy" (Or for those that don't know, that is often called "The Charlie Brown Song.")

Very solid. Could definitely go well with some violin backup. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img]

[img]http://i34.photobucket.com/albums/d134/Galaxieretter/Keen-thumbs-up.gif[/img]

And Levellord the first actual Commander Keen remixed part is directly at 3:00. (Actually the little tune starts at 2:59 and goes to 3:04) It is very easy to pick out.

[quote]Quote:[hr]If you get this movie done, we'll have yet another god to worship.

title: Re: Ooh!
content:
Ello all, sorry I havn't been posting anything for a while. Lots of stuff in real life to contend with (had to dash down to London quite a bit, sorting out house which im moving into, family etc). I also just secured a commission over the summer for my student union making the fresher DVD, proceeds of which are being piped into this film.

Good news is that I have a few weeks of doing piss all in which I can REALLY focus on this thing. I intend on getting some sort of website up and raising funds to make it. For all movie buffs I have secured a Canon XL1-s to shoot the thing in. Ok its not HD, but its an f'ing good camera for a student :P

Thank you to all who liked the music [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img] More will be on its way soon, including a properly mixed version of the bloogwater theme.

Might have a few issues with the cast. Main problem being they are in Southampton and I am in Manchester / London. I have scored a few good actors up here however, and will be popping round local drama places with the script. Hopefully I will get a shooting schedule by the end of August ready for a September / December shoot.

I have a question to ask the fans: The script I have written can be interpreted as a comedy or as a parody - which would you prefer? Comedy as in it is funny, or parody as in it rips on other sci-fi movies as well as Commander Keen.

Thank you for your continued support [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

Regards,

title: Yay.
content: Definitely comedy over parody. I've never been a fan of crossover stuff. Keen lives in a completely different Universe to Spock. References I can deal with, but if the movie features characters from other series, for example, it'll lose some of its charm. (Not that it won't still be awesome to see a Keen movie).

title: Re: Yay.
content:
Agree, comedy! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-lol.gif[/img] Good luck!3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Yay.
content:
Some crossover stuff works, for instance with super hero comic books.
There's nothing wrong with Keen meeting by Snake Logan, or Cosmo meeting Duke Nukem either.
Aliens vs Predator isn't that much of a stretch either (although sometimes this kind of thing brings continuity errors), but when I recently discovered there was a Batman vs Predator comic series I was surprised.

However, Star Trek's Scotty getting into a losing battle with Jabba the Hutt, only to win in the end because Donald Duck comes to the rescue, aided by Christina Aguilera...
No, I really don't like stuff like that.

It works for parody, something that really doesn't take itself seriously, but it is often used in stories that are supposed to be more serious in nature as well.
That is one of the reasons I don't like fan fiction.
(Some others being the (often) low quality of the writing, and major non-canonical events happening influencing/explaining things in the official stories for instance.)Retodon8

title: Re: Yay.
content:
here, to keep you happy in the meantime this is a bit of a scene for you.

===

Keen is in his ship. Lonely music in the background (almost montage scene).
Keen flies the ship past amazing space backdrops. Camera back to Keen, he
is looking sad. His console starts beeping. He snaps out of his daydream and
looks at the monitor. He then gasps and looks out the window. A strange
electrial storm is approaching and fast, like a tear in space. Keen tries
to escape but cant, all his controls get knocked out. Keen stares out his
side window in fear as the tear overwhelms him.

Bright light, white screen. The room then turns into a small metallic cabin,
with smooth metal walls and floor. He is lying on a bed. The room has some
scientists in it monitoring computers, a small radar dish pointed at his bed.

A scientist approaches

Unknown
Hello there! You ok?

Keen (groans)
Where am I?

Unknown
Your in a hospital, we cought you falling into the tear and took you here
before you caused a traffic jam.

Keen (half awake, confused)
What the...?

Unknown (frowns)
What universe you from?

Keen
I'm from 'the universe' universe?

Unknown
Ah yes, your the only universe that was so un-imaginative, that they decided to call it 'the universe'.

Keen
What you on about.

Uknown
Oh yes, you lot are causing a lot of problems at the inter-dimension summit.

Keen
Err.. where am I?

Unknown
(sighs) Oh yes, I forgot. Here, let me explain...

You know the theory that there could be multiple dimensions that sometimes tear open in places?

Keen
Like black holes?

Unknown
Got it, now, our people a long time ago figured out how to get through to the over side. That was billions of years ago. Now most of them are used up.

Keen
What, thats impossible!

Unknown
Oh its nothing special, people gotta commute aint they?

Keen
Aren't there infinite universes?

Unknown
Well, there's enough room left for another trillion years or so. Oh dear. Ok, this is why you shouldnt be here. You know about the Vorticans and the Galactic Alliance right?

Keen (nodding)
Ok, thats all of modern physics proved wrong just now, but yeah...

Unknown
Well imagine the same thing between universes. Your universe is considered an 'anomoly'

Keen (stll in amazement, worried)
Is that bad?

Unknown
Yes

Keen
Why so bad?

Unknown
Because we are on the verge of an interdimensional war.

Keen
Ah.

The two sides dispute your universe. It was ignored on the most because your all so stupid. For that reason neither side claimed it. Now they want it. Well, they don't really, they just want to piss us off. It's all just a load of bollocks really...

(keen is still in amazement)

they've all agreed that to end the tension we should just blow up your universe, let no-one have it. No-one gives a toss about you really.

Keen
Whoa Whoa Whoa, your saying we could be wiped out any instant?

Unknown (shrugs)
Decision was made last week

Keen (open mouthed and alarmed)
You have GOT to be shitting me.


Room around Keen fades away and leaves him on a table in a cottage looking over temperate waterfall on an alien planet. The room is full of people wearing cardboard box outfits like robots.


RobotMan 1 (jumps and puts hands in air out to keen)
April Fool!

=======

title: Re: The good the bad and the little bit too old.
content:
I know your all skeptical, but I promise, it will work!

and yes, he is not 8. That was one of the decisions I took in early planning: scrap the young keen. It isnt going to work. I couldnt think of a situation where it would look normal for an 8-year-old to do half the stuff in the games, let alone a movie adaptation.

In that pic he is wearing a cycle helmet as we were unable to secure an American Football helmet.

I thought that as it is an older keen, it would be better to place him in older-style clothes. Make him look a bit trendy even. Meh, when you see the film you will get it :P

EDIT: (Imagine a cross between hitch-hikers and commander keen, thats sort of what the movie will be like, with a lot more sarcasm thrown in)
